channel.title: Static IP not working when I portforward
channel.description:
Alright, so, my static IP that I've portforwarded on my router is not working with the port 43594, I just get this error when I try to do it:
[code]java.net.BindException: Cannot assign requested address: bind at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind0(Native Method) at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind(Net.java:444) at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind(Net.java:436) at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketChannelImpl.bind(ServerSocketChannelImpl.java:214) at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketAdaptor.bind(ServerSocketAdaptor.java:74) at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketAdaptor.bind(ServerSocketAdaptor.java:67) at com.rs2.Server.startup(Server.java:250) at com.rs2.Server.run(Server.java:202) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:724)[/code]
But, when I use my IP that starts with 192.168.... It works. Can anyone tell me why?

item.title: Static IP not working when I portforward
item.dc:creator: @NickyBRUV NickyBRUV
item.description:
@NickyBRUV wrote:

is your port open? for me even though it reads its open it is not, check here: http://www.yougetsignal.com/tools/open-ports/

Read full topic
item.source: Static IP not working when I portforward

item.title: Static IP not working when I portforward
item.dc:creator: @sorecheeny sorecheeny
item.description:
@sorecheeny wrote:

Alright, so, my static IP that I’ve portforwarded on my router is not working with the port 43594, I just get this error when I try to do it:
